meta.name: description
meta.content: Pamlico County School District serves students and is located in Bayboro, NC.

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1850px; height: 894px;

div.div: Click here for a special message from Ms. Lisa Jackson, Superintendent of Pamlico County Schools.
The Pamlico County Board of Education will meet on Wednesday, April 8 at 12:00 pm. (Follow the link for details about the meeting.)
Please follow the link for an important update from Pamlico County Schools.
The Pamlico County Board of Education will hold an Emergency Meeting on March 25, 2020 at 5:30pm. Please follow the link for important details about the meeting including remote viewing options.

article.aria-label: Pamlico County Board of Education Meeting

h3.a: Pamlico County Board of Education Meeting

div.div: Location: 507 Anderson Dr, Bayboro, NC 28515, USA
Location: Fred A Anderson Elementary, (Parking Lot) 515 Anderson Dr, Bayboro, NC 28515, USA

div.strong: Hello and Welcome to Pamlico County Schools!

div.div: My name is Lisa F. Jackson and I am excited to welcome you to our new and very improved website! I am honored to begin my third year serving as your superintendent. At Pamlico County Schools, we strive to make our schools a place where students are excited to learn and employees are inspired to be their best. We reach for excellence each and every day. Additionally, we strive to maintain safe campuses and to inspire our students to achieve their optimal level of learning.

PCS is proud to be an integral part of the Pamlico County Community. I have been a part of this community for 28 years as an educator at various levels from Pre-K to Community College. I am so proud of my students (current and former)! I can honestly say that my best and most rewarding work was being a teacher in Pamlico County Schools! As an educator for almost three decades, I pride myself in getting to know the people I work with. The relationships I have made with educators, students, and parents are ones that will last a lifetime!

My roots run deep in Pamlico County. My mom was a 1964 graduate of Pamlico County High School before she and my dad moved down the road to Aurora, where I grew up and attended school for 12 years. After graduating from East Carolina University with a degree in Early Childhood Education, I made my home in Pamlico County where I have raised both of my children.

div.strong: Pamlico County is truly “a great place to live and work”. I invite you to stop by and visit one of our four schools and see why I am so full of PAMLICO PRIDE!!!

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 410px; height: 520px;
position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 680px; height: 435px;

div.div: Pamlico County Schools, in partnership with home and community, will prepare all students for further education and to be productive, responsible citizens who function effectively in a changing world.
